intro: Meyna hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan meyna, is a flowering plant native to China's Hainan Island. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and elliptical leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
